channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Snap Reaches One Billion, Meta’s New XR Apps, OpenAI’s Ive Teases Design, Suno AI Settles
item.description: Snap nears 1 billion users, Meta unveils WorldGen, Warner cuts a deal with Suno, Ive and Altman tease OpenAI hardware, Apple adds Vision Pro sports co...

item.title: “Our GPUs Are Melting” Warns Sora Boss As New Limits Are Imposed
item.description: OpenAI imposes new limits on the number of videos non-paying users can generate, after the company struggles to meet demand on its servers.

item.title: ‘Stranger Things’ Season 5 Resurfaces Its Worst Episode Ever
item.description: Stranger Things season 5 has some problems, but the twist in one storyline harkens back to the worst moment of the series.

item.title: Black Friday faces its ultimate test as desperate retailers and low consumer confidence collide in a high-stakes holiday standoff
item.description: "Consumers feel on edge," says Mastercard chief economist Michelle Meyer.

item.title: NYT Strands Hints, Spangram, Answers: Saturday, November 29 (What A Piece Of Work!)
item.description: Looking for some help with today's NYT Strands? An extra hint and the answers are right here to help you finish the grid and keep your streak intact.

item.title: IRS releases guidance for Trump's 'no tax on tips' and overtime deductions: What to know
item.description: The IRS released new guidance for no tax on tips and overtime deductions under the One Big Beautiful Bill Act. Eligible workers can claim up to $25,00...

item.title: Trump says he wants to ‘permanently pause migration’ from poor countries: ‘Only reverse migration can fully cure this situation’
item.description: Donald Trump spent part of his Thanksgiving holiday railing against immigrants on social media.

item.title: Billionaire MacKenzie Scott once needed her college roommate’s help with a $1,000 loan: ‘That’s just what you do for friends’
item.description: Years later, Scott repaid the favor when Jeannie Tarkenton started Funding U, a lending company that offers merit-based loans to low-income students.

item.title: U.S. stocks lift on the last day of November as Wall Street eagerly awaits the results of Black Friday
item.description: Wall Street is operating on an abbreviated schedule Friday after being closed for the Thanksgiving holiday.

item.title: The Louvre will hike prices for everyone who isn’t from Europe—from $25 to $37
item.description: Last year, the Louvre welcomed 8.7 millions visitors. 77% of them were foreigners.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
